title: Suspended Permanently  for "modifying my client" when i didn't - unjust permban. + i'm 100% innocent
body:
I was told by someone i assume by riot on twitter by the name of "@Elthision" who told me to write a post so you can talk to me about my ban, but nothing about getting my account back. Which is why i originally said no to this. But i really am innocent and i really have done nothing wrong. the worst that can happen is that you could tell me a lie and tell me i'm not getting my account back - in that case i'll be forced to take further action. Hopefully we can get this sorted and i can get back to playing with my friends as I've not been able to play with them for almost a month now. and i'm feeling really bummed out as now i feel disconnected from my friends and i spend most of my days inside, only leaving to work.

Overall this incorrect ban has lead a huge destructive path and is affecting my life, friends and even my uncle says i'm not as smiley as much anymore.

I dont know how to work this, but i'm going to try to post the support tickets pictures so we can "talk" against my better judgment.

replies.body:
submit your logs to riot, they can look for mods, if no mods are found thats best way to prove inno

also ask where their "proof" is thats you modded. They could at least supply you with evidence as to why they banned you

They can't supply evidence because knowing what they did detect tells scripters what they DIDN'T detect, and gives them ways to subvert the system. That is why support will never give you the evidence. However if you feel the ban was made in error then submitting your logs to them is a good idea.

The thing is while that may be the case, i somehow doubt the OP had anything that was over the top, because hell i think riot were banning people using overwolf at one point (if i recall it was before timers were released due to there being camp timers on Overwolf)

Ah yes, I was looking for this link :)

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/5dmkJinG-3rd-party-applicationsmodifications-whats-allowed-and-what-isnt

It lists most of the common 3rd party programs and whether they are permitted or not, as well as doing a good job of explaining why or why not. 

It may very well have been he was using something he thought was allowed, or something that had disallowed features and he didn't realise, unfortunately in such a case he's still considered at fault. In most of these cases it comes back to the "you are responsible for all action on your account". If he could prove the account had been compromised he may get some assistance with a new account from support though, I don't really know too much about how that part of the process works.

The thing is given that list, what is the OP likely using that he would be making a post like this without knowing what his using is bannable?

I mean the only thing that says isn't allowed (outside of editing Game.cfg which might i add makes me and anyone who has rebound Left click to Attack move as bannable, simply because you can't bind left click in game) is MKLOL, and not knowing that this is directly what would be the cause is a stretch to say the least.

Well in the end he's the only one who can tell us. There may have been something he didn't realise was a third party program (if it dressed up as Riot or if he isn't fully aware of what's defined as 3rd party). It could also be he played at a friends house or someone got access to his account which was where it happened.

I just viewed all programs on that list, half i've never hard of and the ones that do, i dont even use, i dont even use overwolf, sure i have it installed but i used it for SMITE a few times, thought it was not the best compared to skype for me.

so overall, didnt use any :/

I believe I know where the confusion is coming from.

It appears your account was being elo-boosted, and was detected for 3rd party tool usage at the time. Someone else may have been playing on the account, but as the creator you are responsible for any actions taken on the account. This permanent ban cannot be reversed.

And so it was not being elo boosted. Sooooooo? what do i do?
that's insane. why would ispend $1000 or more on my account and then get it elo boosted? that's actually insane. There has been a serious mistake.

Have a look at your s4 games. Pretty average bronze player. All of a sudden in S5, you go from bronze to gold with an 81% winrate on riven (who you hadnt used previously) a 58% winrate on Leona (previous winrate was 27%) and your vayne winrate skyrocketed to 63.7% when in s4 you played her only a few times. It certainly looks fishy. If that account was also accessed from overseas during this period I would definitely ban for boosting...
Mate thats account sharing and absolutely bannable.

Bannable to play with friends. GG
That didn't really help.

You were banned for third party/cheating/scripting, not for account sharing (though it may have contributed). Riot takes the use of disallowed 3rd party programs, hacks scripts, cheats etc VERY seriously, and will ban you permanently and without warning if they detect their use on your account.

Being a paying customer does not get you any special treatment. Someone who has spent $2000 on the game will get the same treatment as someone who has spent nothing.

You don't own your account, you lease it from Riot. They aren't obligated to give you any warning if you are found to be in violation of their terms. 
[ToU section IV. Ownership](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse)
The reason they give warning for toxicity is because that behaviour can be reformed, or a relatively infrequent thing, but cheating/scripting etc is somethign that Riot has a zero tolerance policy for and thus will be banned without warning.

There isn't really anything else to add here. The ban was not made in error, you will not receive a refund and your account will not be unsuspended.

Playing with friends and having a friend play on YOUR account is very different. If you wanted to watch your friend to get better then watch him play on HIS account. You are responsible for all activity on your account, and boosting/sharing your account in this manner is a bannable offense.
As was mentioned before, if you want to appeal your ban submit a support ticket [HERE](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new),
Never used it i don't think. I did install overwolf at one point but never used it cos it was worse than Curse. Curse made my league freeze every 10 seconds for about 2 seconds
is LoLWiz in the "ban able offence" category? I know a few people who use overwolf overlay just to access LoLWiz and sometimes use its 10 sec death recap record to see where they went wrong.

Anyway, hopefully you've received a resolution that works for both you and Riot.
